title: Hong Kong ETFs tumble as China moves to enact new security laws
description:
Exchange-traded funds with exposure to Hong Kong sold off Friday after Beijing said it was considering new security laws that would curtail the territory's autonomy, increasing tensions between China and the U.S. The iShares MSCI Hong Kong ETF fell 5% mid-morning, while the First Trust Hong Kong AlphaDEX Fund [s:FHK] was down 6.4%. The iShares MSCI Pacific ex-Japan ETF , which has only about 32% of its portfolio invested in Hong Kong, still fell more than 2%. All three funds were on track for their steepest weekly decline since the coronavirus market crisis of mid-March.

Market Pulse Stories are Rapid-fire, short news bursts on stocks and markets as they move. Visit MarketWatch.com for more information on this news.

title: Senators to propose sanctioning Chinese officials over Hong Kong security law: WSJ
description:
U.S. senators are introducing a bipartisan bill that would sanction Chinese officials and entities who enforce the new national-security laws in Hong Kong, the Wall Street Journal reported Thursday. The legislation also would penalize banks that do business with the entities, the Journal said. The report said Sens. Chris Van Hollen, a Maryland Democrat, and Pat Toomey, a Pennsylvania Republican, had been already working on the bill, but developments on Thursday made it more urgent. China has signaled it will impose new national-security laws on Hong Kong, dealing a blow to the territory's autonomy, the Journal wrote.
